section.title: Introduction
section.p: DML is general purpose XML schema particulary well suited to books, articles and annotations in other XML sources.
DML is normatively available as a RELAX NG schema with additional Schematron assertions to cover all cases.

DML is a simple set of elements and attributes which define the basic semantics for a generic document. Its designed keeping in mind that all specialization may be defined through an scoped XML schema. For example, to markup code it may be used the CodeML schema.
The metadata model use a set of metadata attributes which are originally defined in RDFa Syntax from W3C.
This specification has an style and nomenclature conventions to simplify reading process.

section.title: Namespace
section.p: The DML namespace has the URI http://purl.oclc.org/NET/dml/1.0/. Usually it is used associated with dml prefix.
